item.title: A Newspaper for COVID-19 — The CoronaTimes
item.description: It seems that the way that I consume information has changed a lot. I have become quite a news junkie recently. One thing, in particular, is that I have been reading quite a lot of international news to determine the stages of Covid-19 in my country.

item.title: Bamboolib — Learn and use Pandas without Coding
item.description: Have you ever been frustrated by doing data exploration and manipulation with Pandas?

item.title: How did I learn Data Science?
item.description: I am a Mechanical engineer by education. And I started my career with a core job in the steel industry.

item.title: Python’s One Liner graph creation library with animations Hans Rosling Style
item.description: I distinctly remember the time when Seaborn came. I was really so fed up with Matplotlib. To create even simple graphs I had to run through so many StackOverflow threads.

item.title: 3 Awesome Visualization Techniques for every dataset
item.description: Visualizations are awesome. However, a good visualization is annoyingly hard to make.

item.title: Top Data Science Resources on the Internet right now
item.description: I have been looking to create this list for a while now. There are many people on quora who ask me how I started in the data science field. And so I wanted to create this reference.

item.title: Create basic graph visualizations with SeaBorn- The Most Awesome Python Library For Visualization yet
item.description: When it comes to data preparation and getting acquainted with data, the one step we normally skip is the data visualization. While a part of it could be attributed to the lack of good visualization tools for the platforms we use, most of us also get lazy at times.
